title: The history of marriage - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What was the main purpose of marriage in sedentary agricultural societies about 10,000 years ago?

options.label: A
options.text: To secure rights to land and property by designating children born under certain circumstances as rightful heirs.

options.label: B
options.text: To secure rights to trade and commerce by designating children born under certain circumstances as rightful heirs.

options.label: C
options.text: To secure rights to labor and resources by designating children born under certain circumstances as rightful heirs.

options.label: D
options.text: To secure rights to military service by designating children born under certain circumstances as rightful heirs.

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the earliest surviving written laws in the Mesopotamian Code of Ur-Nammu that provided many specifics governing marriage?

What was the practice of having multiple simultaneous marriage allowed in many ancient civilizations, but not always possible for commoners due to demographic realities and the link between marriage and wealth?
What was the name of the practice of publicly recognized same-sex unions in ancient Rome?
What was the purpose of conducting ghost marriages in China?

options.label: A
options.text: To continue family lineages or appease restless spirits.

options.label: B
options.text: To secure rights to land and property.

options.label: C
options.text: To secure rights to trade and commerce.

options.label: D
options.text: To secure rights to labor and resources.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main concern of commoners when choosing a spouse, according to the transcript?
What was the impact of industrialization, urbanization, and the growth of the middle class on the concept of marriage?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a decrease in the importance of individual happiness and pursuits.

options.label: B
options.text: It led to an increase in the importance of familial duty and wealth and status.

options.label: C
options.text: It led to a focus on individual happiness and pursuits, rather than familial duty or wealth and status.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the concept of marriage.

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the practice of brother-making in Orthodox churches?
What was the first instance of a same-sex union being called "Marriage" in recorded history?

options.label: A
options.text: In ancient Rome, where the Emperors Nero and Elagabalus both married men in public ceremonies.

options.label: B
options.text: In ancient Greece, where the philosopher Plato advocated for same-sex relationships.

options.label: C
options.text: In ancient China, where the practice of ghost marriages was conducted.

options.label: D
options.text: In ancient Mesopotamia, where the Code of Ur-Nammu provided specifics governing marriage.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main point of the transcript about the evolution of marriage?

options.label: A
options.text: That marriage has always been the same across cultures and time.

options.label: B
options.text: That marriage has always been a universal and timeless institution.

options.label: C
options.text: That marriage has always been shaped by society and has changed over time.

options.label: D
options.text: That marriage has always been a private matter between individuals.

multiple-choice.question: What event occurred about 200 million years ago that drove South America and Africa apart?

options.label: A
options.text: The formation of the supercontinent Pangaea

options.label: B
options.text: The collision of the Indian Plate with the Eurasian Plate

options.label: C
options.text: The breakup of the supercontinent Pangaea

options.label: D
options.text: The movement of the tectonic plates

multiple-choice.question: What is the approximate rate at which the ground below you is traveling across the Earth?
What is the highly viscous but solid rock portion of the upper mantle?
How many primary tectonic plates compose the shape of the planet we know today?
What is the transition zone where the granitic continental crust meets the basaltic oceanic crust?
What are some of the driving forces behind the movement of the tectonic plates?
What type of boundary occurs when two plates move away from each other?
What type of boundary occurs when two plates collide?
What is the name of the 810 mile-long fault line where two plates scrape past each other?
According to a projected map, what will happen to the cities of Los Angeles and San Francisco in millions of years?

options.label: B
options.text: They will be on top of each other

options.label: C
options.text: They will be separated by a large distance
